DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Heparin M-EDTA may prevent catheter-related infection blockages patient high risk catheter-related infection . It yet know whether heparin effective M-EDTA prevent catheter-related infection blockages patient high risk catheter-related infection . PURPOSE : This randomized clinical trial study heparin see well work compare M-EDTA prevent catheter-related infection blockages patient high risk catheter-related infection .
DOC.brief_title: Heparin M-EDTA Preventing Catheter-Related Infections Blockages Patients High Risk Catheter-Related Infection
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - Compare incidence catheter-related infection ( Staphylococcal Candida ) patient high risk catheter-related infection treat heparin v minocycline hydrochloride edetate calcium disodium ( M-EDTA ) . Secondary - Compare incidence catheter occlusion patient treat regimen . OUTLINE : This randomize , double-blind , prospective , multicenter study . Patients stratify accord type catheter ( tunneled central venous catheter [ CVC ] v nontunneled percutaneous CVC ) participate center . Patients randomize 1 2 treatment arm . - Arm I : Patients receive minocycline hydrochloride edetate calcium disodium ( M-EDTA ) flush solution CVC daily . - Arm II : Patients receive heparin flush solution CVC daily . Treatment arm continue 3 month absence unacceptable toxicity removal catheter . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 150 patient accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : At high risk acquire catheter infection , evidence following : Diagnosis leukemia , lymphoma , myeloma , melanomasarcoma Undergoing hematopoietic stem cell transplantation Receiving aldesleukin Pediatric cancer patient New ( ≤ 10 day old ) function externalize tunnel nontunneled central venous catheter ( CVC ) , Hickman/Broviac Hohn catheter , peripherally inserted central venous catheter ( PICC ) utilize infusion chemotherapy , blood blood product , intermittent infusion No occluded CVC No exist local systemic catheter infection More 3 day since removal prior CVC due infection No externalize CVC project remain place < 2 week No infusion port Groshong catheter No coat CVC impregnate antimicrobial antiseptic agent PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Life expectancy ≥ 3 month No history allergy tetracycline No contraindication flush solution dwell time ≥ 4 hour No hypocalcemia receive calcium supplementation catheter Not pregnant nursing Fertile patient must use effective contraception PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : See Disease Characteristics
